source_tabular.description: A breakdown of the tabular data source types in the dataset. Each label indicates whether it applies to the dataset, with supporting evidence from the paper.

Human-Generated.description: The tabular data is entirely compiled, filled, or annotated by human, e.g. spreadsheets, survey results, and census data.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this label applies to the dataset. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper where the human-generated nature of the tabular data is stated or supported (e.g., 'Section 3.2').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the tabular data is classified as human-generated.

Model-Generated.description: The tabular data is produced by AI models, e.g. outputs from text-to-table conversion, summarization, and produced through some generation tasks.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this label applies to the dataset. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper where the model-generated nature of the tabular data is stated or supported (e.g., 'Section 3.2').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the tabular data is classified as model-generated.

Unknown Origin.description: The source of the tabular data is not specified, not reported, or derived from web-crawl data with unclear provenance.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if the dataset includes tabular with unknown provenance. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper indicating the information of the tabular data (e.g., 'Appendix A').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the origin is considered unknown.

N/A.description: The dataset does not contain any tabular data.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if the dataset contains no tabular data. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper confirming that the dataset does not include tabular data (e.g., 'Section 1.1').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the dataset is not applicable for tabular-based analysis.
